frame.name: Aiming
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> adjusts an <fen>Instrument</fen> to enable it to interact directly with a difficult-to-access <fen>Target_location</fen>. Usually, there is a <fen>Targeted</fen> entity at the <fen>Target_location</fen> which is mentioned in its place.
<ex>If <fex name="Agent">you</fex> <t>aim</t> <fex name="Instrument">your weapons</fex> <fex name="Target_location">somewhere else</fex> , I 'll be more likely to talk .</ex> <ex><fex name="Means">The sortie</fex> <t>targeted</t> primarily <fex name="Targeted">resupply points</fex> , but these included several civilian areas . <fex name="Instrument">INI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">A good marksman</fex> still should take <t>aim</t> <fex name="Duration">for a moment</fex> <fex name="Time">before each shot</fex> . <fex name="Instrument">INI</fex> <fex name="Target_location">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual that manipulates the <fen>Instrument</fen> to enable interaction with the <fen>Targeted</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Targeted
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Targeted</fen> is the entity located in an indirectly accessible location relative to the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>I tried to <t>target</t> <fex name="Targeted">his left thigh</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Outcome
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Outcome</fen> is the failure or success of an attempt. </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the aiming is achieved.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> takes aim.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> is a phrase which describes the <fen>Agent</fen> during the event.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> aims at the <fen>Targeted</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any generalized description of the details of the event in terms of comparison to another event or what would be expected of the details given some state of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>She took <fex name="Manner">careful</fex> <t>aim</t> before shooting .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The time peiod over which the adjustment of the <fen>Instrument</fen> takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to interact with the <fen>Targeted</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of <fen>Particular_iteration</fen> indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is independent of the the aiming of the <fen>Agent</fen>, but contextualizes it.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to interact with the <fen>Targeted</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Target_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to ready the <fen>Instrument</fen> to access.
<ex>If you <t>target</t> <fex name="Target_location">towards the bridge</fex> , make sure to avoid the church .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location from which the proto-agent acts or perceives. This does not include the location of a thing which is affected or perceived in the event.
<ex>With remote drones , you can <t>target</t> Moscow <fex name="">from your own living room</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Activity</fen> is undertaken by the <fen>Agent</fen> and is directed towards the <fen>Targeted</fen> or <fen>Target_location</fen>.
<ex><fex name="act">The attack</fex> <t>targeted</t> a village south of here.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>A larger event during which an aiming event takes place.
<ex>Milatary convoys were <t>targeted</t> by rebels <fex name="con">in several attacks</fex> over the past week.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that provides an explanation for the Aiming event.
<ex>They were <t>targeted</t> <fex name="exp">because they were the most prominent supporters of the establishment</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: aim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: point (a weapon or camera) at a target.

lexUnit.name: target.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: select as an object of attention or attack.

lexUnit.name: aim.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the aiming of a weapon or missile.

lexUnit.name: target.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person, object, or place selected as the aim of an attack.

lexUnit.name: direct.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: aim (something) in a particular direction.
